td.a: News Release Regarding Accomack County School Board April 21, 2020 Regular Meeting

br.br: Due to COVID-19 social distancing, the Accomack County School Board April 21, 2020 Regular Meeting will be broadcast remotely starting at 6:30 p.m. To listen live go to http://accomackcountyva.swagit.com/offsite-live. If there are any public comments for the meeting, please fax or email your comments to the School Board Clerk at 757-787-2951 or gretta.smith@acps.k12va.org. Please abide by the Public Comment rules that are normally listed prior to starting public comment. Any comment that does not adhere to these rules will not be read.

Dear Accomack County Public Schools Families,
We want to thank our ACPS families and stakeholders for their patience and support as we transition into our new normal. Ensuring that all students were provided with an opportunity to receive several meals per week has been a major focus thus far. However, we remain committed to providing ALL students with the best education possible. We realize that we cannot duplicate the instructional practices at home which teachers implement in their classrooms. We further understand that there are major discrepancies in access to technology to include hardware and internet services among our students. During these unprecedented and challenging times, we know that facilitating home instruction might not be a priority for every family, however we need every parent and/or guardian’s collaboration to ensure that our students remain engaged in their academic journey during these challenging times.
With the Governor’s statewide closure of schools for the year, we are moving forward with a Continuity of Learning plan for the Division. Our goal is to provide learning opportunities which will review and enhance content taught before March 13, 2020. Our instructional delivery model will be a blended approach realizing that one size does not fit all. Some teachers will teach through a virtual classroom model while others will use packets to deliver instruction. Parents will be given the opportunity to pick up learning packets at meal pickups or the packets will be mailed or emailed to parents. Teachers will keep the lines of communication opened with parents and students by way of scheduled office hours, emails, or other methods implemented to stay connected. Our Continuity of Learning Plan outlines the procedure we will implement as we continue with the 2019-2020 school year and includes an equitable plan for teaching content not taught as of March 13, 2020 to all students.
Continued...

td.a: Accomack County Public Schools Food Distribution

br.br:
Accomack County Public Schools' Superintendent W. C. Holland announces beginning Wednesday, April 15, 2020 that Food Service distribution will be changing to two (2) days a week, Monday and Wednesday.
On Mondays, we will be serving 2 meals, and on Wednesdays, 3 meals from 5:30 to 6:30 p.m. at the designated schools.

td.a: Accomack County Public Schools Meal Pickup Will Resume 4/14/2020

br.br: Accomack County Public School's student meal pickup locations will be not be operating from April 6, 2020 to April 13, 2020 due to the school district's scheduled spring break. Student meal pickup will resume on Tuesday April 14, 2020. Please be safe.
